def: the process of removing material using a rotating cutting tool
a machine for shaping metal or wood by rotating it against a tool
the programmed route followed by a cutting tool
the speed at which the cutting tool moves through material
the rotating axis of a machine tool
a device used to hold workpieces in place during machining
a liquid used to reduce heat during machining operations
the allowable deviation from a specified dimension
a type of milling cutter used for profiling, slotting, and contouring
a device for holding a rotating tool or workpiece
a hard material used for making cutting tools
the grooves on a cutting tool that allow chip removal
rotations per minute â€” a measure of spindle speed
a reference line for motion in a machining system
a sleeve used to hold a tool or workpiece
a language used to control CNC machines
the first stage of machining to remove bulk material
the final machining pass to achieve required surface quality
the play or lost motion in a mechanical system
the ease with which a material can be machined
